elpacho1313 wrote:
> Another issue: I use ther tooManyHopsDecideRule at the end of the
> decideRules list but it doesn't seem to work as I wanted to... I mean
> it goes deeper.

DecideRules have two parts: the condition under which they apply (in 
this case, more than the configured number of hops), and then the 
decision to apply in that case.

TooManyHopsDecideRule is set up to always apply its default REJECT 
decision, but if you hand-editted the order.xml, it's possible it was 
changed to ACCEPT.

However, from your frontier report, it looks like most queues have 
finished, which implies some sort of limit has been successfully 
applied. Do you see URLs in the crawl.log with 'hops-path' strings (the 
collection of uppercase letters like 'LL' or 'LE') longer than two 
characters?

- Gordon @ IA
